title: List Running Processes
scenario: See which processes are currently running on your system.
hints: Use ps to see process status
The aux options list all users and full info

title: Top Command
scenario: Start the top command to see live CPU and memory usage of running processes.
hints: Use top to see live resource usage

title: Tree View of Processes
description: Display processes in a hierarchical view
scenario: View the process tree to understand parent-child relationships.
hints: Use pstree to show process tree

title: Find Process by Name
description: Locate a process using its name
scenario: Find if the process 'nginx' is running.
hints: Use pgrep to search processes by name

title: Kill a Process
description: Terminate a running process by PID
scenario: Stop a process with PID 1234 using the appropriate command.
hints: Use kill to terminate processes by PID

title: Force Kill Process
scenario: Forcefully terminate a process with PID 5678.
hints: Use kill with -9 to force kill
This sends SIGKILL to the process

title: Background Process
description: Run a command in the background
scenario: Run the sleep command in the background for 60 seconds.
hints: Use & at the end of the command to run in background

title: Bring Background Process to Foreground
description: Move a background process to foreground
scenario: Bring the most recent background process to the foreground.
hints: Use fg to bring a background process to foreground
It resumes the last suspended process

title: Suspend Process
scenario: Suspend a running process with Ctrl+Z or using a command.

title: Resume Suspended Process
scenario: Resume a suspended process with PID 2345.
hints: Use kill with -CONT to continue a stopped process

title: View Process Tree with PID
description: Show process tree starting from a specific PID
scenario: Display the process tree for PID 1000.
hints: Use pstree with the PID as argument
Shows hierarchy starting from the PID

title: Show Process Memory Usage
description: Check memory usage of a process
scenario: Show the memory usage of the process with PID 4321 using pmap.
hints: Use pmap to display memory map of a process

title: Nice Value
description: Change the scheduling priority of a process
scenario: Start a process with lower priority using nice.
hints: Use nice to set process priority
The -n flag sets the nice value

title: Renice a Process
description: Change the priority of an already running process
scenario: Increase the nice value of process PID 3456 to 15.
hints: Use renice to change process priority

title: Real-time Process Monitoring
scenario: Start htop to monitor processes interactively.
hints: htop provides an interactive process viewer
It shows CPU, memory, and process tree
